'Turn' is the eponymously titled third full-length offering from the Irish indie
trio Turn. Turn offered a more pop/singer songwriter direction for Meath based
band. Their first album, [[Antisocial (album)|Antisocial]], had shown a strong
Pixies style influence, their second album, [[Forward (Turn album)|Forward]],
offered an even darker side to the bands sound, but with Turn they showed they
weren't getting any darker. The album was a mixture of catchy pop tunes such as
"It's About Nothing" and "Stop", and also more Elliot Smith inspired tunes, such
as "Close Your Eyes" and "Wildside".

Opinions were very mixed about the album among fans and critics. Some called it
a mile stone in musical growth for the band, others claimed it was a last-ditch
effort by the band to become more commercial and popular on the Irish airwaves.
However, the strength of the songs proved themselves and became live favourites
instantly on the tours that followed.
